docs.snippet: A Senate internal security subcommittee called a sudden halt yesterday to its open hearings on subversion among United Nations employes but promised to bring into the open "very important matters" after Jan. 1.
docs.lead_paragraph: A Senate internal security subcommittee called a sudden halt yesterday to its open hearings on subversion among United Nations employes but promised to bring into the open "very important matters" after Jan. 1.
docs.abstract: subcom suddenly halts hearings but will continue work; McCarran says new considerations have arisen; comments on plans; urges drastic methods, if needed, to deal with subversion; subcom, at closed session; hears N Corwin, radio consultant to UN, and unidentified witness; Corwin atty A G Hays says he appears voluntarily

headline.main: Senate Hunt for Reds In U. N. Is Suspended; SENATE RED HUNT IN U. N. SUSPENDED

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 13 -- Although polite diplomatic notes are being exchanged between Argentina and Uruguay, an undeclared economic boycott by the Peron Government is harassing almost all international airlines and steamship companies as well as...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 13 -- Although polite diplomatic notes are being exchanged between Argentina and Uruguay, an undeclared economic boycott by the Peron Government is harassing almost all international airlines and steamship companies as well as causing untold difficulties for tourists and foreign business men residing here.
docs.abstract: Argentina continues econ boycott of Uruguay

headline.main: PERON CONTINUES URUGUAY BOYCOTT; Tourists and Foreign Business Seriously Affected by Ban -- U. S. Protests Fail

byline.original: By EDWARD A. MORROWSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 13 -- High-level diplomatic talks were held here and elsewhere in New York today as part of the delicate task of trying to work out a formula that might bring a cease-fire in Korea.
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 13 -- High-level diplomatic talks were held here and elsewhere in New York today as part of the delicate task of trying to work out a formula that might bring a cease-fire in Korea.
docs.abstract: 21-nation-resolution sponsors conf, US delegation offices; seek truce formula; reptdly discuss Indian plan; Eden, Schuman and Acheson conf privately; India reptd in contact with USSR bloc reprs, NY, Moscow and Peiping

headline.main: 21 Delegates to U.N. Confer On Korea Captives Solution; DELEGATES TO U. N. CONFER ON KOREA

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 13 -- Secretary General Trygve Lie declared today that the suicide of Abraham H. Feller, General Counsel of the United Nations, resulted from overwork in defending United States members of the Secretariat "against...
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 13 -- Secretary General Trygve Lie declared today that the suicide of Abraham H. Feller, General Counsel of the United Nations, resulted from overwork in defending United States members of the Secretariat "against indiscriminate smears and exaggerated charges."
docs.abstract: Sec Gen Lie and Sen Internal Security Com statements

headline.main: Secretary General Says Aide Sought Justice for Those Accused of Subversion; LIE LAYS SUICIDE OF AIDE TO STRAIN

byline.original: By THOMAS J. HAMILTONSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: Abraham H. Feller, $18,000-a-year General Counsel to the United Nations, plunged to his death yesterday afternoon from a rear window of his twelfth-floor apartment at 50 Central Park West, at Sixty-fifth Street. His wife, Alice, said he had declared...
docs.lead_paragraph: Abraham H. Feller, $18,000-a-year General Counsel to the United Nations, plunged to his death yesterday afternoon from a rear window of his twelfth-floor apartment at 50 Central Park West, at Sixty-fifth Street. His wife, Alice, said he had declared his intention to kill himself, had run frenziedly through the eight-room apartment, broken away when she tried to hold him back, opened the window, and jumped.

headline.main: A. H. Feller, Ill 2 Weeks, Eludes Wife's Effort to Prevent Suicide; U. N. OFFICIAL DIES IN 12TH-FLOOR LEAP

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: The Canadian dollar was shaken sharply last week in a selling wave which dropped it to a premium of 1 3/8 cent (on Wednesday), lowest since early May. The rate stiffened moderately near the close with Friday's final of 1 5/8 cent, reflecting a loss...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Canadian dollar was shaken sharply last week in a selling wave which dropped it to a premium of 1 3/8 cent (on Wednesday), lowest since early May. The rate stiffened moderately near the close with Friday's final of 1 5/8 cent, reflecting a loss of 1 1/8 cent over the previous week.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; Week Ended Nov. 14, 1952.

docs.snippet: PARIS, Nov. 19 -- Spain was admitted today as the sixty-sixth member of the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization. The vote was 44 to 4, with seven abstentions. The action was taken speedily after delegates moved to proceed...
docs.lead_paragraph: PARIS, Nov. 19 -- Spain was admitted today as the sixty-sixth member of the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization. The vote was 44 to 4, with seven abstentions. The action was taken speedily after delegates moved to proceed to a vote without debate.

headline.main: SPAIN IS ADMITTED AS UNESCO MEMBER; Vote Is 44 to 4, 7 Abstaining at Paris Session -- Libya and Nepal Are Also Elected
